title: Shot calling coach, or at least tips needed.
body: I am always looking for ways to improve my play, and right now, I am focusing on my ability to shot-call, even a few tips from those of you who are experienced r5s shotcallers would be helpful. I have looked up everything I can find, and have been trying to implement it into my play, but I still don't feel like I'm ready for it. Anything you can tell me will be helpful. Like what things to consider and when to consider them, maybe even a few basic factors in play in most games I might not even be thinking about.

replies.body:
be more aggressive and just fucking open if its there/ur suppose to.

ur suppose to is defined as IRRELEVENT of other players bad calls, they should of been there, don't adapt, don't compromise for garbage, open anyway.

honerstly #1 tip that would raise skill that ive observed in 3 years of this god forsaken hell whole of recent moba reiteration engaugative
